# Random Video UID Selection

## Year: 2002

### Subjects

The focal individuals in the 2002 footage can be found in Table 1.

**Table 1**

|Subject  | Sex | Age Class  |

### Video Unique Identifiers
There are 121 videos in the Bossou Video Archive taken in 2002 which contain nut-cracking. The unique identifiers (UIDs) for these videos, and a corresponding numerical code for each, are found in the Table 2, below. The codes were assigned by ordering the UIDs in ascending order and then providing an integer value for each UID starting from 1 and increasing by a value of 1 each time.

### Data Collection
The focal subjects appear in the videos to varying degrees. For data collection, the videos will be randomly selected for each subject to reduce bias. This requires information on which individuals can be found nut-cracking in each video. Accordingly, a data frame has been created with this information.

In the data frame, 1 = present and 0 = not present.

```{r}
library(tidyverse) #load tidyverse
library(readxl)
subject_videos_2002 <- read_excel("~/Documents/Oxford/DPhil/Project Components/Methods/Data/Subjects UIDs by Year/2002_subject_UIDs.xlsx")
subject_videos_2002 #print table
```
**Fana**

```{r}
fana_02 <- c(1,5,8,13,17,18,29,36,37,40,41,42,46,50,53,54,56,57,59,61,72,73,76,92,103,106,107,108,114) #create the vector
set.seed(123) #set the seed to make the sequence of random numbers replicable
sample(fana_02, 29, replace = FALSE) #sample the vector and use replace=FALSE to sample without replacement
```
